itemDescription: British man of letters; editor of the Athenæum

wikipedia_page.main: Norman MacColl (1843–1904) was a Scottish man of letters, known as a Hispanist and editor of the Athenæum.

response: Editor from 1871 to 1900 was Norman MacColl. During the 19th century, the Athenaeum received contributions from Lord Kelvin. During the early 20th Century, its contributors included Max Beerbohm, Edmund Blunden, T. S. Eliot, Robert Graves, Thomas Hardy, Aldous Huxley, Julian Huxley,  Katherine Mansfield, George Santayana, Edith Sitwell, and Virginia Woolf.

In his last years Rae felt his lack of recognition. He reviewed for The Athenæum, whose editor Norman MacColl was a close friend, and spent his time mainly at the Reform Club; he had joined in 1860, and was chairman of the library committee from 1873 till his death. He died on 21 January 1905 at 13 South Parade, Bath, Somerset, and was buried at Bath.
